venkatesh.name: Venkateshwara Chaudhary
venkatesh.shortBio: Passionate about leveraging technology to solve real-world challengesâ€”from communication, logistics to community engagement.
venkatesh.fullBio:
IT Director & Co-founder

As IT Director for Robert Fradette's campaign and co-founder of Citoyens en Action, Venkateshwara brings the power of technology to grassroots politics in Montreal. With an MBA from McGill University and a B.Tech in Computer Science, he combines strategic thinking with hands-on technical expertise.

By day, Venkateshwara works as a Senior Infrastructure, MLOps, and DevOps Engineer at a global corporation, designing and managing complex technical systems. By evening, he channels this expertise into building digital platforms, designing communications, and creating tools that help citizens engage with their local government.

His vision is simple but powerful: technology should serve people, not the other way around. Whether architecting enterprise solutions or building websites for community movements, Venkateshwara is committed to designing systems that make organizations more effective and democracy more accessible.

The Collective was founded by the late Martine Michaud in 2021 to give a voice to residents of the neighborhood who, while showing great compassion for people experiencing homelessness, deplore the visible deterioration of their community â€” unsanitary conditions, crime, incivility, and vandalism. The closer one gets to the intersection of Milton and Parc, the more unbearable the situation becomes.

AndrÃ©e has been actively involved in petitions, demonstrations, support for the Ombudsman, coordinating questions at borough council meetings, communicating with Collective members, and more recently, appearing in the media.

Issues.title: Key Issues
Issues.subtitle: Our movement is focused on addressing the most pressing challenges facing our community with practical, evidence-based solutions.

openDoorTroubles.title: Open Door Troubles
openDoorTroubles.description: The homeless center Open Door at 3535 Avenue du Parc serves 50-70 individuals daily but has significant limitations. It operates only during the day with just 30 beds, leaving many outside. This has led to increased drug use, theft, aggressive begging, and public hygiene issues. We are committed to moving the facility to a more suitable location with expanded capacity.

safety.title: Students, Child & Elder Safety
safety.description: Despite repeated requests, police presence in Jeanne-Mance remains insufficient. This has contributed to knife stabbings, harassment, and bullying. Students, children, and families deserve to feel safe. We are calling for increased, consistent police patrolsâ€”particularly on bicyclesâ€”to ensure quicker response times and restore confidence in our community's safety.

garbagePestControl.title: Garbage & Pest Control
garbagePestControl.description: Overflowing trash bins and improperly managed waste have created unsanitary conditions and a rapid increase in rats. We demand a comprehensive strategy including more frequent waste collection, secure rodent-resistant bins, stronger littering enforcement, and a coordinated pest control program to restore cleanliness.

affordableHousing.title: Affordable & Safe Housing
affordableHousing.description: Rising housing costs are putting homes out of reach for students, young families, and seniors. Poorly maintained apartments and neglectful landlords create unsafe conditions. We propose stricter enforcement of housing standards, enhanced tenant protections against unfair rent increases, and investment in new affordable housing projects.

parksGreenSpaces.title: Public Parks & Green Spaces
parksGreenSpaces.description: Parks and playgrounds suffer from neglect, poor maintenance, insufficient lighting, and limited facilities. We propose better maintenance, creation of new recreational spaces, addition of benches and safe pathways, and enhanced lighting to ensure safety during evening hours for students, families, and seniors.

trafficRoadSafety.title: Traffic & Road Safety
trafficRoadSafety.description: Busy streets pose risks for pedestrians, cyclists, and drivers. Speeding vehicles and poorly marked crosswalks have resulted in accidents. We propose improved pedestrian signals, expanded protected bike lanes, speed control measures, and special focus on safety around schools, parks, and student housing.

noiseQualityOfLife.title: Noise & Quality of Life
noiseQualityOfLife.description: Late-night disturbances around student housing, bars, and nightlife venues disrupt families and seniors. We propose stricter enforcement of noise bylaws, coordination with universities to minimize disturbances, balanced nightlife regulation, and noise-reduction measures during construction projects.

localBusinessSupport.title: Local Business & Community Engagement
localBusinessSupport.description: Small businesses struggle due to safety concerns and cleanliness issues. Residents feel disconnected from decision-making. We propose incentives for local businesses, clean and safe commercial streets, creation of a neighborhood advisory council, and expansion of community events to foster belonging.
